channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: This obscure indicator with an impressive record has a bullish message for the stock market
item.description: As the ratio rises, the shorter-term outlook for equities gets better and better.

item.title: How investors can position their portfolios ahead of the 2024 presidential election
item.description: Differences in GOP and Democratic economic policies mean there are nuanced ways for investors to position their portfolios based on the election outcome.

item.title: East and Gulf Coast ports strike, with ILA longshoremen walking off job from New England to Texas, stranding billions in trade
item.description: ILA union longshoremen at East Coast, Gulf Coast ports walk off the job after ownership and labor failed to reach a deal in a blow to the U.S. economy.

item.title: Oil prices drop, with supply concerns outweighing worries over Middle East
item.description: Oil futures kicked off October and the fourth quarter on a down note, feeling pressure from expectations for increased supply as traders continued to look past an escalation of tensions in the Middle East.

item.title: In the wake of Hurricane Helene, questions about government response emerge
item.description: In western North Carolina, where more than 40 people have died, some residents say the government was unprepared for the storm.

item.title: With shares at 10-year lows, Assassin's Creed maker Ubisoft faces questions over its future
item.description: Gaming firm Ubisoft is facing questions over its future amid a lackluster games pipeline and pressure from an activist investor to sell itself and go private.

item.title: This hedge-fund manager says it‚Äôs a ‚Äòmax-long‚Äô moment for stocks
item.description: A ‚Äòcocktail‚Äô of factors lead one investor to get very bullish.

item.title: CVS is working with advisors on strategic review, sources say
item.description: CVS Health's board has engaged advisors to conduct a strategic review of its business, according to people familiar with the matter.

item.title: S&P 500 futures are little changed to start the fourth quarter: Live updates
item.description: The S&P 500 and the Dow Jones Industrial Average posted fresh record closes to wrap September's final session.

item.title: ‚ÄòI believe she made a big mistake‚Äô: My wife put her paycheck into a bank account with her inheritance. Do I now own 50% of those funds?
item.description: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm still working, and we‚Äôve always filed joint tax returns.‚Äù

item.title: AI chipmaker Cerebras files for IPO to take on Nvidia
item.description: Cerebras faces competition from Nvidia, as well as cloud providers that have developed in-house chips for running artificial intelligence models.

item.title: Abu Dhabi's ADNOC to acquire German chemicals firm Covestro for $16.4 billion
item.description: Abu Dhabi's state oil firm ADNOC announced it will buy German firm Covestro in a 14.7 billion-euro deal ($16.4 billion).

item.title: ‚ÄòThis money is not bringing me a lot of happiness‚Äô: My husband and I have $7 million, but our kids are trouble. Should we cut them off?
item.description: ‚ÄúHis son and his wife are not good to us. We rarely see them and they never offer to help us with anything.‚Äù

item.title: Hurricane Helene: Trump speaks in Georgia, bashes Harris for not traveling there
item.description: Donald Trump bashed Vice President Kamala Harris and President Joe Biden in politically charged terms over their response to the deadly Hurricane Helene.

item.title: Euro zone inflation falls to 1.8% in September, below the European Central Bank's 2% target
item.description: Euro zone inflation fell to 1.8%, below the European Central Bank's target rate, in September, flash data from statistics agency Eurostat showed Tuesday.
